text: James Wood Jr. (January 28, 1741June 16, 1813) was an American military officer and politician. He was born in Winchester, Virginia. He was an officer of the U.S. Continental Army during the American Revolution.Sally Wister, ‘‘Sally Wister's Journal: A True Narrative: Being a Quaker Maiden's Account of Her Experiences with Officers of the Continental Army, 1777-1779’’. Applewood Books, Bedford, Massachusetts, 1994. Entry for Oct. 20, 1777. Wood was the 11th Governor of Virginia from 1796 to 1799. Wood was replaced as Governor by future President James Monroe. He was a member of the Federalist Party. Wood died on June 16, 1813 in Richmond, Virginia at the age of 72.Gov. James Wood ==References== ==Other websites== *A Guide to the Governor James Wood Executive Papers, 1796-1799 at The Library of Virginia *James Wood at National Governors Association * Category:1741 births Category:1813 deaths Category:Governors of Virginia Category:Military people from Virginia Category:Federalist Party politicians Category:18th-century American politicians
title: James Wood (governor)
